Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy new TUDA head.description: TIRUPATI: Chandragiri YSRC legislator Dr Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy took charge as the chairman of Tirupati urban development authority (TUDA) on Sunday. Tirupati MLA Bhumana Karunakar Reddy felicitated the new chairman and appealed to him to strive for the overall development of TUDA. The new chairman vowed to preserve the sanctity of the temple city in line with the sentiments of the visiting devotees and the locals alike. ‘‘Our top priority will be to provide clean water to all. We have a vision document and we will deliver the best of services to the citizens in a transparent manner,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh government readies to sup.description: VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh government has geared up with Rs 1,700 crore infrastructure to ensure uninterrupted free power for nine hours to the farm sector. Stating that farmers’ welfare is the highest priority for the government, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has directed officials to work out modalities and make foolproof arrangements to provide nine hours of free power daily for agriculture sector during day time. According to energy minister B Srinivasa Reddy, power utilities are preparing modalities to begin the prestigious scheme. The state has 18.15 lakh pumpsets and 6,663 agriculture feeders. Of them, 4,951 feeders are ready for the nine-hour scheme. Keeping in view Tuesday’s meeting on the modalities of the nine-hour supply, the minister held a teleconference on Sunday. The state has proposed tariffs at Rs 1.50 a unit for aqua farmers, free power to SC, ST colonies up to 200 units a month, and Rs 12,500 to each farmer towards input cost. He said several states had followed the system introduced by former chief minister YS Rajasekhar Reddy. The scheme had been diluted later. Now, Jaganmohan Reddy wants to strictly implement the free power scheme and stop crop losses due to interruptions in power supply to borewells. The CM will directly contact farmers in future to know the ground reality on the nine-hour power supply” Srinivasa Reddy said. After the review of the power sector on Tuesday, a report will be submitted to the chief minister. Energy secretary and Transco chairman and managing director N Srikant said of the 6,663 agricultural 11 KV feeders in rural areas, only 1,712 feeders require some additional infrastructure to begin the nine-hour power supply during day time. Erection of 16 extra high-tension substations, 32 capacitor banks, 52 power transformers and 112 km of extra high voltage lines 220 KV should be completed to make these feeders ready. These balance 26% agriculture feeders will also be given nine hours supply in two spells (five hours during day time and four hours in night) until they are ready with full infrastructure. When officials informed about the pending loan amount of Rs 3,700 crore approved by the World Bank to improve infrastructure under Power for All scheme, the minister told them the matter would be brought to the notice of the chief minister. B Sreedhar, managing director, APGenco, said it has installed capacity of over 5213 MW. All measures have been taken to optimise the generation capacity of APGenco keeping in view the abnormal increase in demand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will launch toll free number for women's.description: VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh to have a toll free number for women. Home minister Mokathoti Sucharitha on Sunday said that safety of women is going to be the top priority for them and introduction of toll free number is one among the slew of measures going to be launched. She also announced that the government will issue notification very soon to fill all vacancies in the police department. Sucharita assumed her office in second block of Andhra Pradesh Secretariat at Velagapudi on Sunday. She signed the file clearing medical reimbursement for constables as her first file after taking charge. She said welfare of police personal will be taken care of in YSRC government. “All police personal in the state will get one weekly off like any other employees. The work has already begun in this regard and we will implement weekly offs for cops very shortly,” she said. Sucharita observed that there is an urgent need to work towards curbing crimes against women and children. Taking a reference to the Tadipatri pastor incident, Sucharita said that she received a call from the girl’s mother. She complained how her daughter was subjected to sexual abuse by the pastor. I have directed the cops to take immediate action and they have booked the pastor and arrested him in less than two days. All complaints pertaining to crimes against women and children will be dealt in the same manner. Sucharita noted that though there is a chance of creating four battalions in the state post-bifurcation, the previous government did not formed them. We are going to form four battalions very soon out of which one is of ‘women battalion’ and the other one will be ‘tribal battalion’. The results regarding 2018 recruitment will be announced shortly and the notification for remaining vacancies in the department will also be released, said Sucharita. She noted that friendly policing initiatives will be launched to create an atmosphere where anyone can walk into police stations to lodge complaints and for grievance redressal. Ammavodi cash to harm govt schools, fear.description: VIJAYAWADA: Some schools in the state have already started to advertise about the Rs 15,000 benefit under the state government’s Ammavodi scheme even before the government has finalised it. The state government has announced that monetary benefit under Ammavodi will be extended to all parents who were sending their children to school whether it is a private or a government school. However, detailed guidelines of the scheme are yet to be formulated and notified. While private school managements are upbeat over the new scheme and hope that this will be attractive to parents and would increase student strength, experts and student organisations are expressing concerns over the scheme. PDF MLC KS Lakshman Rao said that the scheme in its present form will be disadvantageous to government schools in the state. He fears that if parents get benefit to support their children’s education, everyone might send their wards to private schools. “The government should give the benefit to only those who send their children to government schools,” said Lakshman Rao. State general secretary of Progressive Democratic Students Union (PDSU) A Ravi Chandra fears that the scheme in its present form will hasten the privatisation of education in the state. “The first causalties of the scheme will be the 8,000 government schools running with single teacher,” he said. Requests have been pouring in to the offices of education minister A Suresh and government advisor Ajeya Kallam to change the scheme to limit the benefit only to government schools. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaganmohan Reddy makes strong pitch for.description: VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy on Saturday made a strong case for grant of special category status (SCS) to AP before the governing council meeting of Niti Aayog in Delhi, stating that in the absence of SCS, educated youth from the state are migrating to other areas in search of employment opportunities. He spoke at length, supported by documentary evidence, to press for SCS. He requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to fulfil the promise given to the people of AP at the time of bifurcation. He also tried to impress upon the PM and others that giving SCS to AP is fulfilment of the constitutional obligation as it was promised in Parliament. It’s also a political commitment, he added, as the BJP had included the promise in its 2014 election manifesto. Jagan built a strong case for SCS to AP by producing a copy of Union cabinet’s decision of March 2, 2014, which directed the Planning Commission to grant SCS to AP. He produced a copy of the letter of the 14th Finance Commission member Prof Abhijit Sen, in which he denied that he had recommended the abolition of SCS. The CM tried to justify his SCS demand on the ground that except AP, no state in the country was bifurcated with a promise of giving SCS as a precondition. “No state was bifurcated against the wishes of majority of its people and against the resolution of the state assembly. The residuary state does not have a capital city,” Jagan stated, adding that the per capita grants to special category states is Rs 5,573, whereas AP received only Rs 3,428. 68,000 devotees offer prayers at Tirumal.description: TIRUPATI: The temple of Lord Venkateswara saw heavy rush of pilgrims on Sunday. Devotees have been flocking to Tirumala for the three days now as summer vacation nears the end across the country. According to TTD sources, the waiting time for ‘sarva darshan’ stretched up to 28 hours by the evening on Sunday. As many as 68,047 devotees offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara till 6pm on Sunday. All the compartments in the twin Vaikuntam Q complex were full and the pilgrims were forced to wait outside. Besides the regular hundi collection, TTD received Rs 23 lakh as donations to Sri Venkateswara nithya annaprasadam trust and Sri Balaji Arogya Varaprasadini scheme on Sunday. Meanwhile, the annual “Jyestabhishekam” reached a crescendo at the Tirumala temple. A series of special rituals were held and Lord Malayappa swamy with his two divine consorts Sridevi and Bhudevi were re-draped with the gold armour. A colourful procession was taken out later in the evening as the Lord and his divine consorts blessed the devout. Thousands took part in the procession on Sunday. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Girls shine in open school class X exams.description: Vijayawada: Only 69.93% students passed the class 10 examination of the Andhra Pradesh open schools society (APOSS) while 67.82% cleared the Inter exam. While 56,149 students had appeared for the class 10 exams, 64,279 students appeared for the Inter. The results of both the exams were released on Saturday.  While girls toppled boys in the class 10 exams with a pass percentage of 73.7 (as opposed to the boys’ 67.58), boys did a little better in Inter with 67.8% passing the exam (66.45% girls passed Inter). While releasing the results, education minister Aadimulapu Suresh appreciated the results from Prakasam district which had the best numbers in the exams and asked officials from Nellore, Visakhapatnam and Kurnool to focus on improving the results. He expressed his disappointment with the Visakhapatnam coordinator for being negligent towards his duties. Suresh did this while conducting a review meeting with APOSS coordinators from 13 districts. “The open school system is to provide an opportunity for those who failed to attend regular schools. We should conduct examinations in a transparent manner without encouraging mass copying, fake candidates and other forms of malpractices,” the education minister said. Jagan unlikely to accept BJP\u2019s Lok.description: VIJAYAWADA: YSR Congress supremo and chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Saturday told party MPs that there was no need for an alliance with the BJP, indicating that he is not prepared to accept any posts at the Centre including the Lok Sabha deputy speakership. The decision is in tune with his pre-election stand that YSRCP would support any political party that would give special category status to AP. Since the BJP has not yet responded positively on the SCS issue, he wants to wait. Jagan was addressing the parliamentary party meeting of YSRCP in Delhi on Saturday. He, however, said there was no need for the MPs to go into a fighting mode with the BJP-led Central government. “We will have some good relations with the BJP. There is no rivalry nor friendly relationship with the BJP as of now. Our relationship is healthy,” said party MP from Hindupur Gorantla Madhav. However, Jaganmohan Reddy had told every MP to be in touch with the government in getting new schemes to the state and also clearing all pending bills. Jagan had set the core issue of Special Category Status issue as the agenda for the party MPs in Parliament. Jagan wanted the MPs to be vibrant and vigilant. Jaganmohan Reddy had told the MPs to keep the SCS issue alive all through the Parliament sessions. He told them that the party with 22 MPs in Lok Sabha should get more time in the House to raise issues concerning the state. “Use every opportunity to demand SCS,” he said. The chief minister had further told them that he would divide them into groups and give departments to deal with both inside and outside the Parliament. The MPs concerned should take up the issues with the departments and see that funds are given from the Centre without delay. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Retailers continue to flout court order.description: Vijayawada: Even though the Supreme Court and the state consumer forum had issued orders against the sale of branded plastic bags, the practice goes on unabated across Vijayawada. From supermarkets to major wholesale dealers, vendors have been charging between Rs 10 and Rs 25 for branded plastic or cloth bags. According to the judgement of the consumer forum last year, plastic bags can be sold only if they are not branded. The local municipal body was empowered to implement the order. The body was given the authority to impose fines ranging from Rs 9,000 to Rs 18,000. “Recently, one of the Decathelon showrooms in Hyderabad was fined for selling branded carry bags. Prior to that, a Bata showroom in Chandigarh was held for contempt of court for a similar issue,” said Harish Shekhawat, a city-based consumer activist. Officials of the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) said that they are first focussing on weeding out harmful plastic bags and will subsequently focus on the issue. Shekhawat further said that consumers blindly shell out money for carry bags exhibiting the brand name, without the awareness that the brand logo entitles them to get it for free. Many major retailers continue to violate the law as they would rather be fined once than lose a major source of income from customers. In their defence, retailers say that manufacturing these bags cost much more than disposable bags and they have already laid out a suggestive notice to bring their own bags. The public can keep the bill where they have been charged for branded carry bags and lodge a complaint through the Meekosam mobile application. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh family of 4 found shot in.description: VIJAYAWADA: Mystery shrouds the death of four members of a Telugu family who were shot and killed at their home in West Des Moines city, Iowa, in the US on Saturday. Sunkara Chandrasekhar (44), his wife Lavanya (41) and their two sons aged 15 and 10, were shot and killed, a police statement said. The family was originally from Tsundur in Andhra Pradesh’s Guntur district and were living in the US for at least the past two decades. On Saturday at around 10 am, a local resident contacted the emergency number 911 after being informed about gun shots being heard in Chandrasekhar’s house. Police officials, who rushed to the spot, found the four lying dead with gunshot wounds. Sources close to the family said that they had moved into the house only in March. A family friend, who is also a member of Telugu Association of North America (TANA), told TOI on condition of anonymity that Chandrasekhar has been suffering from depression for a while and that there might have been a dispute in the family. In an Instagram post, local police explained that at the time of the shooting other family members, including two adults and two children, were living in the house as guests. After discovering the bodies, one of them rushed out looking for help. He found someone who then called up 911. The police have not revealed the identity of the guests. Although the police have not given any details about the motive behind the shooting, they have stated that there is no immediate threat to the community and that the deaths directly affect their family friends and co-workers. They have also said that investigations had revealed that at the time of the gun being fired, no outsider had entered the house. This is being interpreted by many that a family dispute may be behind the deaths. Chandrasekhar worked for the Iowa department of public safety’s technology services bureau. Sources added that Lavanya too was a software developer. Friends and acquaintances cited his work excellence certificates claiming that he was a hardworking employee. TANA members got in touch with family members in Tsundur and were told that everyone was in a state of shock. They also rejected any help saying that they did not want any attention. Cases booked against SPFs, devotee in Al.description: Tirupati: Tirumala police booked cases against special protection forces personnel and one Dilli Babu, a devotee from Tamil Nadu, late on Friday night in the Alipiri incident, after the TTD’s vigilance and security wing recommended shifting of the SPFs responsible for manhandling the devotee. Tirumala II town inspector, Y Venkateswarulu, told TOI that cases were booked against both on the basis of complaints lodged by the SPF police and the group of devotees. “The incident happened because of communication gap and language barrier. We analysed CCTV footages and recorded statements. Based on the complaints, cases were booked against the devotee as well. But we have not detained them and even allowed them to leave for their home town on humanitarian grounds,” added the inspector. It may be recalled that Dilli Babu was thrashed by SPF cops at Alipiri check-point following an altercation after they tried to seize prohibited tobacco products from him on Thursday. After a video of the beating went viral, the TTD top brass ordered a probe into the incident and subsequently shifted the SPF cops to non-focal points, besides recommending disciplinary action against them. Meanwhile, Bharatiya Janata Party leaders have strongly condemned the incident. A group of leaders led by former TTD trust board member G Bhanu Prakash Reddy met Tirumala police and asked them to book cases against the cops, not the devotee. Eminent doctor passes away.description: TIRUPATI: Dr B Govinda Narayana, resident medical officer at Sri Venkateswara Institute of Medical Sciences (SVIMS) passed away on Sunday night after suffering a heart attack while undergoing treatment at the superspecialty hospital in Tirupati. A condolence meeting was held at SVIMS on Monday. Director cum vice-chancellor, Fellow doctors commemorated the services rendered by Dr Narayana who joined the institution in 2000 as a resident medical officer and served for 19 long years.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Minister reviews progress of Kanaka Durg.description: VIJAYAWADA: The deadline for completion of the Kanaka Durga flyover has been extended till December 31. Since the start of works, this is the fifth deadline that has been set for the completion of the Rs 500 crore project. The Kanaka Durga flyover will maintain traffic flow on the western side of the city and also on National Highway 65. Citizens must brace for traffic curbs again as officials are planning to stop vehicular traffic for at least a month to complete the works. Minister for roads and buildings Dharmana Krishna Das inspected the flyover works on Saturday with endowments minister Vellampalli Srinivas and Vijayawada Central MLA Malladi Vishnu. Krishna Das reiterated that completion of the Kanaka Durga flyover will be taken up on top priority. “If people support us, the works will be completed by end of the year. We want to give the flyover as a new year’s gift to the people of Vijayawada,” he said. Endowments minister Vallampalli Srinivas found fault with the previous government for failing to complete the flyover works. He said the previous government lacked commitment. “Local TDP leaders only made tall claims but could not complete the works. We are going to complete the flyover works in a time-bound manner,” the minister said. MT Krishna Babu, principal secretary of roads and buildings department, said that 85% of the works have been completed so far. The construction company was asked to complete the works in three and a half years in the tender and later told to complete the works within a year. “Because of the company’s internal issues and other problems, they could not complete the works,” Krishna Babu said. Andhra Pradesh: Half-day run for schools.description: VIJAYAWADA: Owing to continuing heatwave conditions in the state, the state government on Sunday issued orders saying that schools will continue their half-day sessions till June 22. Regular hours of the schools will be restored from June 24, according to the latest orders issued by commissioner of school education K Sandhya Rani. The decision was taken after the forecast made by the Andhra Pradesh state disaster management authority (APSDMA) that severe heatwave conditions will prevail across the state of AP for some days now because of the slow progression of south-west monsoon. The school education department had ordered conducting half-day schools after reopening of schools on June 12. All schools in the state were directed to conduct classes from 8am to 12:30pm. Schools in the state have been ordered to follow the instructions in view of the safety of the children. District education officers have been directed by the government to take action against the schools which do not comply with the instructions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two youths drown in West Kukkuleru drain.description: ELURU: Two youths drowned at the West Kukkuleru drain at Modi village in Mogalthuru mandal on Monday evening. The bodies were later fished out by the police. According to the police, a local festival celebrating the village deity Settibalija Mutyalamma was being held at the Perupalem north village on Monday morning. Hundreds of villagers had gathered to offer prayers to the deity. After the ‘jatara’ (local festival), the villagers too the deity’s idol to immerse it in the West Kukkuleru drain (also known as Uppeteru). Around 10 youths had gathered for the immersion ceremony. 18-year-old Kavuru Suresh, a resident of Parupalem north village and 20-year-old Donga Ramesh, resident of Mutayapalli village ventured into the water to take a dip. However, soon after both the youths drowned in the water and were washed away. The others gathered immediately informed the police and began a search for the missing youths. Police, revenue and fire officials reached the spot and after a lot of effort, managed to retrieve the bodies. The Mogalthuru police have registered a case. Downsizing of liquor shops not to affect.description: VIJAYAWADA: Even as the government is mulling to downsize the number of wine shops by 20% across the state as a first step in achieving prohibition, excise revenue is likely to be unaffected in the first year. As the government is considering to increase liquor prices to make it unaffordable, margin on liquor sales is likely to be increased compensating the corresponding losses in volumes, according to reliable sources in the excise department. The state government is earning nearly Rs 7,000 crore revenue on liquor sales with an average 16 per cent year-on-year growth. There are about 4,402 wine shops and 826 bars across the state which do retail liquor sales. On the other hand, each wine shop is having eight to 10 belt shops which do illegal sales of liquor especially in rural and sub-urban areas. Now with the new government taking the decision to eradicate all belt shops and also to downsize the number of liquor outlets, the sales volumes are likely to get affected. However, this reduction in number of shops may not affect revenues in the first year, said a senior official on condition of anonymity. As the liquor policy is likely to be tweaked every year to downsize the number of outlets to impose complete liquor ban in next five years, revenues will come down from the second year. The increase in liquor prices, however, will give a one-year window for the government to compensate revenue loss and look for alternative sources. On the other hand, many liquor shop owners are also looking to come out of the trade as the state government’s decision is not favourable to them as they expect tighter norms in the upcoming policy. With the reduction of margins in the previous policy, many of them had ended up in losses. Some who are in the trade for long are also not interested this time to participate in the bidding, said Y Srikanth who runs a bar in Vijayawada. Rowdy-sheeter stabbed to death in Vijaya.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 32-year-old rowdy-sheeter was stabbed to death by two persons on CVR flyover in Vijayawada on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The deceased, identified as Kilari Suresh, was a native of Chitti Nagar. According to Mohammed Umar, inspector of Two Town police station, the murder was carried out around midnight. Suresh stopped an auto on CVR flyover and demanded money from the driver and his friend (who also is an auto driver by vocation). As the two men refused to give him money, Suresh took out a knife and threatened to attack them. Police said that all the three men involved in the incident were in an inebriated state. As Suresh threatened the two friends with his knife, the auto drivers retaliated and attacked him. They snatched the knife from Suresh’s hand and inflicted deep gashes upon him with the knife. Suresh died on the spot with heavy bleeding. Upon knowing about the incident, cops rushed to the spot and shifted the body to a government hospital. Suresh was a habitual offender and drinker. He often used threats to extort money in an inebriated state at Wynchpet and Chitti Nagar areas. He has a rowdy sheet against him at Two Town police station and many pending cases. On the other hand, the auto drivers are said to be natives of YSRC Colony and they do not have any criminal background, according to police sources. Cops are yet to make arrests in the case. Farmers\u2019 welfare set to get lion\u2.description: AMARAVATI: Farmers’ welfare will dominate YS Jaganmohan Reddy government’s first budget, as the agriculture department has sought an allocation of at least 20,000 crore to the sector. This is nearly Rs 15,000 crore additional grant to the allocation made in the vote-on-account budget. The agriculture department has already submitted its draft report to the finance department, which has begun preparing the budget. “CM Jagan wanted farmers’ welfare to be the priority of the government. Allocations in the budget will be in line with our CM’s vision,” said minister of animal husbandry, fisheries and marketing Mopidevi Venkata Ramana. According to the initial proposals readied by the agriculture department, about Rs 8,500 crore will be needed to implement the YSR Rythu Bharosa. According to the scheme, the state government has assured to grant Rs 12,500 to each farmer in the state ahead of the Rabi season in October. Sources said that the chief minister has already directed the agriculture department to include tenant farmers under the scheme. Meanwhile, in order to implement the scheme the state government has already scrapped the Chandrababu Naidu government’s Annadata Sukhibhava scheme, which promised to grant Rs 9,000 per year to small and marginal farmers. As per official data, about 60.5 lakh farmers have been identified in the state who own land and there are another 7.5 lakh tenant farmers. Hence, the department has estimated that financial assistance will have to be extended to nearly 68 lakh farmers, for which it will need Rs 8,500 crore. Apart from this the government has promised to pay, on behalf of the farmers, the interest on a loan of Rs 1 lakh. The department has demanded a Rs 4,000 crore for the interest free loans scheme. The state government has also promised to pay the total premium on agriculture insurance from the exchequer. The agriculture department has estimated that it would require another Rs 2,000 crore to pay the premium. Besides agriculture, for the dairy industry, Ramana said, the government has already signed the proposal to increase the milk procurement price by Rs 4 per litre with immediate effect. This scheme would require at least Rs 200 crore for its implementation. “We are committed to implementing each and every promise made during Jagan’s padayatra and is part of Nava Rathnalu. We will make every effort to spare funds for the hassle-free implementation of the schemes in spite of severe financial crisis,” said agriculture minister Kurasala Kannababu. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Lowering wasteful expenditure is priorit.description: Vijayawada: Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy has started the exercise to prepare his first budget, which will be presented sometime next month. Since taking charge of the crucial ministry, Buggana has been holding review meetings with all department heads to know the state’s present financial situation. “I have just started looking at the finances, and it has shocked me. The previous government completely mismanaged the state’s finances. Though the CAG had warned about the financial mismanagement, the earlier government never paid heed to it. The exchequer is now empty,” he said. The minister further alleged that while the previous government diverted funds from every account, the expenditure was mostly unwarranted. “A big portion of the state’s funds was spent on publicity and other works. Funds from various departments were pooled up and spent on tours and events,” he said, adding that he would require some more time to get to know the actual position of the state’s finances. “Many things need to be readjusted to meet the needs of all departments, and the promises made to people.” The first priority of the government is to cut down on wasteful expenditure, the finance minister said. “Money not spent on extravagance is money earned. We have started with a revenue deficit of Rs 16,000 crore, and there are no major revenue sources. Our government will function keeping this fact in mind. We are committed to bring down the expenditure. Chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy set the tone by going for a simple swearing-in ceremony and also for the swearing-in of the new cabinet (on June 8). This government’s main focus will be on austerity,” he asserted. He also stated that a huge amount of funds needs to be released to the state from the central government. “The previous government did not submit utilisation certificates (UCs) for which funds were not released. We are going to submit the UCs for the funds to be released,” the FM added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

9-yr-old dies in road accident in Tiruma.description: TIRUPATI: A 9-year-old boy on pilgrimage with his family was killed in a road accident when the driver of an SUV lost complete control of the vehicle and hit the devotees. The deceased has been identified as Loka Prasad. According to Tirumala police, the nine-year-old and his family had arrived at Tirumala on pilgrimage. As the family exited the pilgrim’s amentities complex I and were walking down the road near Kalyani rest house, an SUV came and struct them. The child died on the spot. Other devotees too sustained severe injuries. The Tirumala police have registered a case against the driver who reportedly had a fit and lost control of the vehicle. Min seeks better price for tobacco.description: Guntur: Agriculture minister Kurasala Kannababu made an appeal to traders to be generous towards remunerative prices to tobacco farmers. He said that traders should keep the dire straits of the farmers and pick up the stocks at higher prices. On Friday, Kannababu held a meeting with representatives of tobacco traders and farmers Minister following the instructions of chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy. The minister pointed out that it was not proper on the part of traders to be reluctant in picking up stocks in peak season. “You might be having problems in offering high prices due to poor export orders. However, you should not undermine the unrest among farmers as it would permanently hit the trade,” Kannababu advised. He asked the tobacco industry to take small losses in their stride if needed to provide remunerative prices to the growers, particularly those who grow low-grade varieties. He insisted that the prices should not go down further from the prevailing Rs 85 per kg. Former MP Yalamanchili Sivaji said that traders have deliberately slowed down purchases only to offer low prices. He said that growers could not survive unless they were paid at least Rs 120 per kg for the low grades. Farmers alleged that big players were exerting pressure on small merchants to abstain from the market and this was the reason why prices were getting low. ITC CEO Sanji Rangrass said that the stocks being brought by the farmers in the SLS (southern light soil) region were of very low quality and increasing prices could be a tough ask. Indian Tobacco Association (ITA) president Mittapalli Umaamaheswara Rao, on his part, said that there was no demand for low grade varieties in the export market and offering more than Rs 80 per kg was unviable for them. He said that traders were suffering huge losses due to the purchase of inferior quality stocks. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. Heatwave forces govt to extend half-day.description: VIJAYAWADA: The state government on Sunday issued orders extending the half-day schools in view of the prevailing heatwave conditions across the state. The half-day schools will continue for one more week till June 22. The decision was taken after the weather forecast given by Andhra Pradesh State Disaster management Authority (APSDMA) that severe heatwave conditions likely to prevail across the state because of slow progression of south west monsoon. The school education department directed to conduct half-day schools after the reopening of schools on June 12. All the schools in the state were directed to conduct classes from 8Am till 12:30Pm. Normal working hours of schools will be restored from June 24 according to the latest orders issued by the commissioner of school education K Sandhya Rani. The school education department directed the schools to follow the instructions scrupulously in view of the safety of the children. The district education officers have been directed to take action against the schools which do not comply with the instructions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

June 18 now! Wait for monsoon gets longe.description: Vijayawada: The state will continue to experience hot and humid weather conditions till June 18. Weathermen made this forecast given that the south-west monsoon might get further delayed by three to five days owing to the impact of cyclone Vayu in the Arabian Sea. According to the Andhra Pradesh weather early warning and research centre (AWARE), a division of RTGS, most places in coastal and northern Andhra might record high temperatures between 45°C and 46°C in the coming days. On Saturday, temperatures ranged between 44°C to 46°C in 202 locations across the state. While Kanimeraka village in Bondapalle mandal of Vizianagaram district recorded the highest temperature of 46°C in the state, Vechalam village of Visakhapatnam came a close second with temperatures of 45.98°C. The next ranks were taken by Sringavarapukota (45.6C), again in Vizianagaram district, and Poduru (45.18C) of West Godavari district. The Andhra Pradesh real-time governance society said, “13 automatic weather stations (AWS) recorded temperatures between 45°C and 47°C. 124 AWSs recorded temperatures between 43°C and 45°C. Noticeably, all districts witnessed more than 41°C temperature on Saturday. All coastal districts recorded over 45°C.” Once monsoon arrives on June 18, many parts of Rayalaseema and coastal districts might receive moderate to heavy rainfall. “The south-west monsoon is likely to touch Anantapur and Chittoor districts first and then spread across the state,” scientists at AWARE said. The APRTGS has directed district administrations to make necessary arrangements to handle heatwaves. District collectors have been directed to provide ORS and buttermilk to motorists. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Patient dies at SVRR hospital, family cl.description: Tirupati: A patient died at the SVRR government hospital in Chittoor district on Saturday, allegedly due to medical negligence. Ironically, the incident took place within minutes after district collector Narayana Bharat Gupta inspected the hospital. The patient, Babu, had high fever and was admitted to the hospital’s general ward a couple of days ago. His condition worsened on Saturday, his relatives said, alleging that he died as he could not be shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) for want of stretcher. They said they searched for a stretcher for 30 minutes but could not find one in the hospital. Finally, it was the attendant of another patient who managed to get a stretcher. But by the time Babu was shifted to the emergency ward, his condition had worsened. He developed convulsions and died before doctors could start treatment. The bereaved relatives entered into a heated argument with the hospital staff and staged a demonstration. They later took the body home to complete funeral rites. Hospital officials were unavailable for comment. But sources confirmed lack of proper infrastructure led to the patient’s death. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Prove irrigation project irregularities,.description: VIJAYAWADA: TDP questioned the new government’s priorities in the assembly on Monday. The opposition party alleged that the governor’s speech did not include key topics such as Amaravati development, Polavaram Project and industrial policy. Both Houses of the legislature have begun the debate on the motion thanking governor ESL Narasimhan for his address on June 14. In the assembly, government whip Budi Mutyala Naidu moved the motion, seconded by Kakani Govardhan Reddy. They said the government headed by Y S Jaganmohan Reddy is giving priority to neglected sections and farmers. They accused the TDP government of indulging in heavy corruption in Polavaram Project and Pattiseema lift irrigation scheme. TDP leader K Atchannaidu found fault with the governor not acknowledging development in the last five years. He questioned the government for not making any mention of Amaravati and Polavaram Project. He welcomed the ruling party’s decision to order probe into irrigation projects and asked them to prove the charges. He dared them to stop Pattiseema scheme, if YSRC found it useless as some members claimed. “If you think Pattiseema is a wasteful project, I would advise you to stop pumping water from the scheme for this season and see what the farmers would say,” Atchannaidu said. He found fault with the government handing over some buildings of AP to Telangana, without settling the institutions listed in Schedule IX and X of the AP Reorganisation Act. He also wanted the government to check with the energy department and ensure there are no power cuts in the state. Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy blamed the TDP government for not getting funds from the central government or get Schedule IX and X institutions bifurcated in the last four years when the TDP was in alliance with BJP. On developmental issues, the minister said the TDP government had utilised the spillover funds from the 13th finance commission, full funds from the 14th finance commission and funds from MNREGS. “Whatever was spent from these funds had gone mostly to Janma Bhoomi committees ignoring the elected gram panchayat sarpanches and ward members,” the minister said.
